title: Tim McGraw - Greatest Hits
description:
With a sad tenor that sounded like Mr. Haney from Green Acres, Tim McGraw, a freshman in country&#039;s crowded class of &#039;92, seemed the least likely to graduate to superstardom. But eight years and 20 million albums and singles later, here he is with a greatest hits package so stuffed with songs--15 in all--that it doesn&#039;t have room for any new tunes, or even the best of all, "Everywhere." 
McGraw&#039;s appeal is two-fold: Aside from his unlistenable duets with wife Faith Hill and the abysmal "Indian Outlaw" that jump-started his career, he&#039;s had excellent taste in songs. And he&#039;s the epitome of the average guy in search of extraordinary love--the loser who becomes a winner. You see it all here, in the hate-it-but-love-it "Don&#039;t Take the Girl," the adrenaline rush of "Something Like That," and the infectious "I Like It, I Love It." If this album doesn&#039;t give hope to every karaoke singer in America, nothing will.
